newsitem.title: BRAZIL: Brazil's real drops 0.02 pct in calm trading.
newsitem.headline: Brazil's real drops 0.02 pct in calm trading.

text.p: Brazil's real dropped 0.02 percent to close at 1.0248 per greenback in calm trading on the commercial foreign exchange market, dealers said.
Despite net dollar inflows, the real fell because some banks preferred to hold dollars due to expectations of a new drop in the real-dollar mini-band in coming days, dealers added.
The current trade level was set on Oct 14 between 1.0245 and 1.0295 reais per greenback.
On Friday, preliminary figures for commercial and financial foreign exchange contracts showed a surplus of $85 million.
In the interbank foreign exchange floating rate market, the real ended at 1.0305 per dollar, down 0.01 percent.
In the illegal parallel market, the real closed steady at 1.075 per greenback, traders said.
